articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Russian negotiators at peace talks in Istanbul demanded Ukraine pull its troops out of all the Ukrainian regions claimed by Moscow before they would agree to a ceasefire, a senior Ukrainian official familiar with the talks told Reuters.
articles.title: Russia demanded Ukraine cede more territory at Turkey talks, Ukrainian source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's airforce killed at least 58 Palestinians in new attacks on Gaza overnight, local health authorities said on Saturday, as the country appeared set to press ahead with a new ground offensive.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 58 Palestinians overnight

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian drone hit a bus, killing nine people and injuring four more in the region of Sumy, Ukrainian officials said on Saturday, in an attack that took place hours after Moscow and Kyiv held their first direct peace talks in years.
articles.title: Russian attack kills 9, Ukraine says, just hours after peace talks

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: Britain is working with the U.S. to ensure a ceasefire between India and Pakistan endures and that "confidence-building measures" and dialogue take place, foreign minister David Lammy said on Saturday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Lammy says UK, US working to ensure enduring India-Pakistan ceasefire, dialogue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Saturday that Russian President Vladimir Putin could meet Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskiy, but only if certain agreements were reached.
articles.title: Kremlin says Putin could meet Zelenskiy if certain agreements are reached

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Sandra Palleiro is on the hunt for her lost cows. The 60-year-old accountant is standing in a muddy field at the end of a farm track in Uruguay's remote border region with Brazil.
articles.title: Phantom cows and missing millions spark scandal in Uruguay

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police have charged three Iranian men with offences under the National Security Act after a major counter terrorism investigation, the police said in a statement on Saturday.
articles.title: British police charge three Iranians in counter terrorism probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 23 farmers and fishermen were killed and others abducted by suspected Islamist militants in northeastern Nigeria's Borno state this week, security sources and local residents told Reuters.
articles.title: Militants kill at least 23 in Nigeria attack, security sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam and the United States held their first direct ministerial-level negotiations on Friday against the backdrop of an impending U.S. tariff of 46% on imports from the Southeast Asian nation, which could significantly impact its growth.
articles.title: Vietnam steps up talks with US to reduce hefty tariff

articles.author: Ahmed Rasheed, Moayed Kenany
articles.description: Arab leaders at a summit in Baghdad called on Saturday for an immediate end to the war in Gaza, accusing Israel in starker language of trying to drive the Palestinians out of the enclave altogether after it ramped up its bombing campaign.
articles.title: Arab leaders toughen denunciations of Israel as it ramps up Gaza bombing
